column4: Thank god. Ubuntu came back.  Here's my situation... I have a ext3 partition at /dev/sda1 that is just a play partition, nothing important on it.  It currently mounts on / which is not good.  How can I get it to mount on a different mount point?  Everytime I try to umount it, It says drive busy please try manually.  If I use umount -l it makes my whole drive disappear in gparted.  Any ideas
Oh by the way, when booting whats the difference between kernel 386 and kernel generic?
You want generic.  386 is for computers that don't like generic
